Package com.cratediggers.service

Class OrderServices

java.lang.Object
com.cratediggers.service.OrderServices
public class OrderServices
extends java.lang.Object
Handles all business logic for the order module. Follows model-view-controller design architecture by ensuring that the model and view never interact directly.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private OrderDAO orderDao
    OrderDAO object used to interact with the database (the model).
    private javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request
    Contains parameters received by a HTTP request.
    private javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response
    Used to store attributes that are utilised for JSP generation.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs an OrderServices object containing the request and response objects provided by a servlet.

  • Field Details

    • orderDao

      private OrderDAO orderDao
      OrderDAO object used to interact with the database (the model).

    • request

      private javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request
      Contains parameters received by a HTTP request.

    • response

      private javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response
      Used to store attributes that are utilised for JSP generation.

  • Constructor Details

    • OrderServices

      public OrderServices​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Constructs an OrderServices object containing the request and response objects provided by a servlet. Constructs a new orderDAO object used to interact with the database (the model).
      Parameters:
      request - object that contains parameters received in HTTP request made to the server.
      response - object that is used to store attributes which are utilised for JSP generation.

  • Method Details

    • listAllOrder

      public void listAllOrder() throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Provides polymorphism so that listAllOrder(String message) can be called without a specified message.
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • listAllOrder

      public void listAllOrder​(java.lang.String message) throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Retrieves a list of all orders from database. Forwards the list and a specified message onto "order_list.jsp" to display to users.
      Parameters:
      message - to be displayed at top of JSP page
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • viewOrderDetailForAdmin

      public void viewOrderDetailForAdmin() throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Retrieves orderId from request object and gets corresponding albumOrder object from database. Sets the albumOrder order as a request object attribute to be used for generation of the "order_detail.jsp" page.
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • showCheckoutForm

      public void showCheckoutForm() throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Retrieves the shoppingCart object stored in session. Calculates the tax, shippingFee and total costs of an order and stores them in session. These are used to generate the "checkout.jsp" page which is displayed to the customer.
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • placeOrder

      public void placeOrder() throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Retrieves all parameters from the request object and constructs a new albumOrder object. If paymentMethod is equal to "paypal" then constructs a paymentServices object and attempts to authorise the payment. In this case, the albumOrder is stored in session. Otherwise, places a cash-on-delivery order that takes the albumOrder object as input.
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • placeOrderPaypal

      public java.lang.Integer placeOrderPaypal​(com.paypal.api.payments.Payment payment)
      Stores the details of a PayPal payment within the database once successfully executed by the REST API. Receives a payment object which is converted to an AlbumOrder object which can be stored within the database. Once the record is created in the database then the id of the order object is returned.
      Parameters:
      payment - to be converted into an AlbumOrder object and stored
      Returns:
      The stored AlbumOrder object's id

    • saveOrder

      private java.lang.Integer saveOrder​(AlbumOrder order)
      Stores a provided albumOrder in the database (the model). Clears the shipping cart stored in session.
      Parameters:
      order - to be stored
      Returns:
      The Id of the created order record.

    • readOrderInfo

      private AlbumOrder readOrderInfo()
      Reads all fields of an albumOrder form stored as parameters in request object. Constructs a new albumOrder object and sets the fields equal to the specified parameters. Acquires customer object from the logged customer stored in session. Iterates through each item in shopping cart and constructs a new orderDetails object for each, setting their fields and calculating subtotals according to quantity.
      Returns:
      AlbumOrder object based on form fields

    • placeOrderCOD

      private void placeOrderCOD​(AlbumOrder order) throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Places a cash-on-delivery type order by storing the order in the database (the model). Displays confirmation message to customer.
      Parameters:
      order - to be placed
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • listOrderByCustomer

      public void listOrderByCustomer() throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Obtains the genreId provided as a session attribute. Searches the database (the model) for a list of all albumOrders containing the specified customerId as a foreign key. Sets this list as an attribute of the request object. This is used to generate the "order_list.jsp" page for a given customer.
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • showOrderDetailForCustomer

      public void showOrderDetailForCustomer() throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Obtains id provided as a parameter in the request object and customerId of the logged in customer from session. Searches the database (the model) for an album containing the specified id and customerId as a foreign key. Sets the retrieved albumOrder object as an attribute of the request object. This is used to generate the "order_detail.jsp" page for a given albumOrder.
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • showEditOrderForm

      public void showEditOrderForm() throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Obtains albumOrder object that corresponds to the id provided as a parameter in the request object. If album does not exist then displays error message. If album does exist then display "order_form.jsp" in the view, setting the albumOrder object as an attribute in the response object so that pre-existing albumOrder object information can auto-fill in form fields.
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • updateOrder

      public void updateOrder() throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Retrieves all form fields stored as parameters in the request object. Obtains the AlbumOrder object stored in session and sets all fields according to the specified parameters. Updates the corresponding record in the database (the model). Displays confirmation message to user in the view.
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException

    • deleteOrder

      public void deleteOrder() throws javax.servlet.ServletException, java.io.IOException
      Obtains albumOrder object that corresponds to the id provided as a parameter in the request object. If this albumOrder does not exist then an error message is generated and displayed to the user in the view. Otherwise, the corresponding record is deleted in the database (the model) and the user informed by a message.
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException
      java.io.IOException
